selected_quotes: Aberrant sperm DNA methylation predicts male fertility status and embryo quality - Fertility and Sterility
We may be able to identify fertile sperm #infertility
sperm DNA methylation predicts male #fertility status and #embryo quality - Fertility and Sterility
Aberrant sperm DNA methylation predicts male fertility status and embryo quality #malefertility #fertility

citation.abstract:
To evaluate whether male fertility status and/or embryo quality during in vitro fertilization (IVF) therapy can be predicted based on genomewide sperm deoxyribonucleic acid (DNA) methylation patterns.
Retrospective cohort study.
University-based fertility center.
Participants were 127 men undergoing IVF treatment (where any major female factor cause of infertility had been ruled out), and 54 normozoospermic, fertile men. The IVF patients were stratified into 2 groups: patients who had generally good embryogenesis and a positive pregnancy (n = 55), and patients with generally poor embryogenesis (n = 72; 42 positive and 30 negative pregnancies) after IVF.
Genomewide sperm DNA methylation analysis was performed to measure methylation at >485,000 sites across the genome.
A comparison was made of DNA methylation patterns of IVF patients vs. normozoospermic, fertile men.
Predictive models proved to be highly accurate in classifying male fertility status (fertile or infertile), with 82% sensitivity, and 99% positive predictive value. Hierarchic clustering identified clusters enriched for IVF patient samples and for poor-quality-embryo samples. Models built to identify samples within these groups, from neat samples, achieved positive predictive value ≥94% while identifying >one fifth of all IVF patient and poor-quality-embryo samples in each case. Using density gradient prepared samples, the same approach recovered 46% of poor-quality-embryo samples with no false positives.
Sperm DNA methylation patterns differ significantly and consistently for infertile vs. fertile, normozoospermic men. In addition, DNA methylation patterns may be predictive of embryo quality during IVF.
citation.title: Aberrant sperm DNA methylation predicts male fertility status and embryo quality

news.title: Episona Launches First Epigenetic Test for Predicting Male Infertility and Embryo Quality
news.summary: Information contained on this page is provided by an independent third-party content provider.

news.title: Epigenetic Biomarkers Predict Male Infertility
news.summary: University of Utah, University of Southern California, and Episona have established a proof of concept for a novel diagnostic for male infertility by measuring epigenetic biomarkers in sperm DNA.

news.title: Sperm test 2.0: New diagnostics aim to better understand male infertility
news.summary: PASADENA, Calif. — Traditional sperm tests don’t reveal much. They can assess how many sperm a man produces, whether sperm are misshapen, and how well they swim.

news.title: Episona Finishing Validation of Epigenetic Male Fertility Test With Eye on Q3 Launch
news.summary: NEW YORK (GenomeWeb) – Nearing completion of a multicenter validation study, MDx startup Episona anticipates launching its sperm methylation test to diagnose male infertility and predict IVF success by the end of the third quarter this year.

news.title: Sperm test 2.0: New diagnostics aim to clarify male infertility

news.title: New Sperm Tests May Offer Better Understanding of Male Infertility
news.summary: PASADENA, Calif.—Traditional sperm tests don’t reveal much. They can assess how many sperm a man produces, whether sperm are misshapen, and how well they swim.

news.title: Episona unveils first innovative new male fertility test at ASRM 2016
news.summary: Episona Inc., an epigenetics data company focused on improving outcomes in reproductive health, announced today the launch of Seed, an innovative new male fertility test, at the American Society for Reproductive Medicine Scientific Congress& Expo.

wikipedia.title: Infertility
wikipedia.summary: Infertility is the inability of a person, animal or plant to reproduce by natural means.

wikipedia.title: Fertility testing
wikipedia.summary: Fertility testing is the process by which fertility is assessed, both generally and also to find the fertile window.

wikipedia.title: Unexplained infertility
wikipedia.summary: Unexplained infertility is infertility that is idiopathic in the sense that its cause remains unknown even after an infertility work-up, usually including semen analysis in the man and assessment of ovulation and fallopian tubes in the woman.

wikipedia.title: Male infertility
wikipedia.summary: Male infertility refers to a male's inability to cause pregnancy in a fertile female.
